Rights to and Disposition of Data
The term "Subject Data" used herein includes all data or other infor¬
mation which may be developed, created, or published in connection with
the grant* The term does not include financial records and reports, cost
analyses, and other infoimation incidental to grant administration.
All Subject Data shall be, during the term of this grant and there¬
after so long as it remains in the possession of the grantee, available
for study and utilization by the Commissioner and such persons or insti¬
tutions as the Commissioner may designate. Materials which are properly
confidential will be treated as such.
The grantee agrees to and does hereby grant to the Government, and
to its officers, agents, and employees, acting within the scope of their
official duties, a royalty-free, non-exelusive, and irrevocable license
throughout the world, to publish, translate, reproduce, use, and dispose
of, and to authorize others so to do, all Subject Date which is copy¬
rightable *
The Government reserves the right to duplicate, use, and disclose in
any manner and for any purpose whatsoever, and have others so to do, all
Subject Data* This is not in any way to be construed as restricting the
rights of the grantee to publish and/or utilize the results of its work
under this grant*
The grantee agrees to report to the Commissioner promptly and in
reasonable written detail, any notice or claim of copyright infringement
received by the grantee with respect to Subject Data collected or created
under this grant*
